channel.title: Homes on Bhuvesh Kumar
channel.description: Recent content in Homes on Bhuvesh Kumar

item.description: Biography I am a graduate student in the School of Computer Science at the College of Computing in Georgia Institute of Technology working with Prof. Jacob Abernethy. I am interested in Machine Learning Theory and Optimization and I am part of the CS Theory Group. I graduated from IIT Kanpur, India in 2017 with Bachelors of Technology degree in Computer Science and Engineering with a minor in Linguistic Theory where I was advised by Prof.

item.title: Teaching
item.description: Georgia Tech CS7545, Machine Learning Theory (Fall 2018): TA with Prof. Jacob Abernethy Design and grade homeworks and exams. Conduct office hours and deliver special lectures. IIT Kanpur ESC101, Fundamentals of Computing (Spring 2017): Tutor with Prof. Rajat Mittal Took weekly tutorials, set up the course exams, labs, and supervised the TAs Delivered lectures for the online version of the course as well ESC101, Fundamentals of Computing (Fall 2016): Tutor with Prof.

item.title: Activities
item.description: Georgia Tech I co-organise the Georgia Tech ACO student seminar. Reach out if you would like to give a talk. We have a reading group on machine learning theory. Contact Andre if you want to attend or present. I co-organise the College of Computing Grad Student Happy Hour. Join us on our facebook group or mailing list. IIT Kanpur Programming Club, IITK: I was the coordinator of the programming club of IIT Kanpur in 2015-16.
